channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024031376
item.description:
Report X-2024031376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: loadside manager called out a damaged hazmat. HESS specialist responded and brought it back in a lined tote. upon inspection of the contents, HESS specialist found that all the bottles had been packed into the box upside down. HESS specialist reoriented them right side up and placed the tote on the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap and all bottles being packed upside down in box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. bottles reoriented right side up.

item.title: Report X-2024031385
item.description:
Report X-2024031385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: BEMIDJI
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During inbound unload, package was identified as wet by unloaders. Package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and sent to QA for processing. DescribePack: Seal detached under cap causing a small amount of liquid to leak. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed into lined hazmat tote upon discovery.

item.title: Report X-2024031324
item.description:
Report X-2024031324

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler dropped box. Manager contained leaking box in bag and tote. Manager used absorbent to soak up spill. DescribePack: Crushed bottom corner of box. Inside bottle broken into several pieces DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: A fan dispersed vapors. The liquid was absorbed.

item.title: Report X-2024031296
item.description:
Report X-2024031296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: someone repacked this hazmat at STPL on 3/19. photo evidence in SPIDR showing that the outer packaging at CHAR is not the current outer packaging, which is non-UNPOP. someone discovered this leaking on the inbound yesterday and placed it in a lined tote. they brought it to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024031275
item.description:
Report X-2024031275

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on truck, leakage and loose closure noted. PPE gathered, spill neutralized and cleaned up. DescribePack: 1 Missing Cap, 1 Unknown container failure but missing 3/4s of contents, 1 Cap broken. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer and absorbent applied to spill location.
